caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 41–48. Lectotype of
Brachyaulax oblonga (Westwood, 1837)
( 41–44 ) and holotype of
B. cyaneovitta (Walker, 1867)
( 45–48 ). 41 , 45 , dorsal view; 42 , 46 , lateral view; 43 , 47 , ventral view; 44 , 48 , labels. Scale in mm; photos of labels not to scale. Photos by K. Horváth ( 41–44 ) and L. Dembický ( 45–48 ).

FIGURES 49–63.
Brachyaulax oblonga
(Westwood, 1837)
( 49–56 ) and
B. cyaneovitta
(Walker, 1867)
( 57–63 ). 49 , 57 , head of male, dorsal view; 50 , 58 , head and prothorax of female, lateral view; 51 , 59 , pterothoracic pleuron, evaporatorium densely dotted; 52 , 60 , pygophore, dorsocaudal view; 53 , posterior margin of pygophore, dorsal view; 61 , pygophore, dorsal view; 54–56 , 62–63 , left paramere from different aspects. Scales in mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined.
LECTOTYPE (Ψ) (present designation): “ Type ” [circle with red margin, printed]; “Java” [handwritten]; “ oblonga Hope ” [handwritten, folded]; “ Brachyaulax \ oblonga \ Westw.” [handwritten]; “
TYPE
. \ = = \ WESTW . ( HOPE ) \ C. Hemipt. 1837 \ Part I, page 14 . \
Distant, P.Z.S. \ 1900
, p. 807-825 .” [with red frame, printed + handwritten]; “
TYPE
HEM .: No 29 \ TECTOCORIS \ OBLONGA \ WESTWOOD \ HOPE DEPT . OXFORD” [with black frame, handwritten + printed]. Pinned, right antenna, left antennal segments III and IV, all legs distad of trochanters except left hind femur and tibia missing; female terminalia removed, dissected, preserved in plastic microvial filled with glycerol, pinned with the specimen; deposited in OXUM (
Figs. 41–44
).

Discussion.
Brachyaulax cyaneovitta
was decribed from China by
Walker ( 1867 )
. Later it was synonymized with
B. oblonga
(described from Java) by
Distant ( 1899 )
. In his monograph on the Hemiptera of British India , Ceylon , and Burma ,
Distant ( 1902 )
recognized only a single widely distributed species in South and Southeast Asia,
B. oblonga
, and recorded it from several localities from India , continental Southeast Asia, and the Malay Archipelago.
Esaki ( 1926 )
considered the synonymy proposed by
Distant ( 1899 )
as erroneous.
Hoffmann ( 1935 a
, b ) treated
B. cyaneovitta
as a distinct species or as a variety of
B. oblonga
. All other authors subsequent to
Distant ( 1902 )
recognized
B. cyaneovitta
as conspecific with
B. oblonga
.

We examined a syntype of
B. oblonga
(
Figs. 41–44
, hereby designated as lectotype ), the holotype of
B. cyaneovitta
(
Figs. 45–48
), as well as a few additional specimens from various localities. We concluded that the two taxa are different in species level. The diagnostic characters of the two species are presented in
Table 3
.

Because of the long confusion about the identities of
B. oblonga
and
B. cyaneovitta
, the distributions of the two species should be critically reconsidered. We examined specimens of
B. cyaneovitta
from India , China , Taiwan , and Vietnam ; however, possibly several previous records of
B. oblonga
from various localities in continental Southeast Asia refer to other species of
Brachyaulax
, among them
B. cyaneovitta
. Some of the papers providing redescriptions and illustrations of “
B. oblonga
” (
Yang 1934
, 1962 ;
Kumar 1965
;
Hsiao & Zheng 1977
) clearly refer to
B. cyaneovitta
, and these are listed above under
B. cyaneovitta
. All other papers which contain records of
B. oblonga
from continental South and Southeast Asia are considered by us as doubtful and are marked with ‘?’ in the reference list of
B. oblonga
.
